page.title: 07Rodmore Mill
page.content: Rodmore Mill was built in{1629. It hasn't been running since{1881. The owner is Mrs Dorothy Cook. Before it was a mill it was a{forge. The land is used for grazing. They have{16 acres}of land and{4 {fields.}They have some cows but mostly sheep.The mill is four storeys high and used to make brown and white paper.The mill is made of solid stone and now it is falling down. Round the back of the mill there is the remains of a pond.There were{ten {fireplaces}which were used for drying the corn.There was a pipe which led into the pond round the back of the mill. The water went through the pipe and on to the wheel and made it go round.The mill is on the{Cone Brook. {
